text: EDIT, after googling for more:
You might want to give a try at:
Py I/O
Try Python
codepad
codenode
Codepad can compile code, if it's what you're looking for.
http://shell.appspot.com/  The google AppEngine shell (not really an IDE though).
I'm pretty sure that IDE's are the last kind of programs that will ever go web based, because a good IDE needs to be so extremely interactive if it wants to be good.
I really don't see a reason for this and others seem to agree because there isn't any.
And no, an interactive web shell or compiler has nothing to do with an IDE.
I'm trying out PythonAnywhere.com and it has in-browser support for both 3.2 and 2.7.
It also lets you sync to dropbox and deploy right to the web.
Through not specifically for python Codepad is good too.
Mozilla Bespin is an interesting project (user guide).
It is a Mozilla labs open source project to build a browser-based IDE.
You can host it yourself, see the Bespin developer guide.
I don't think it is currently a full-fledged Python IDE, but I believe it could be made into one with a bit of effort.
The Bespin server is written in Python.
ideone.com is able to compile and run Python.
There is also an integrated web editor - perfect for quick tests.
It is not an open source but you can use Ideone API to build your service.
Google Chrome Python Shell  https://chrome.google.com/extensions/detail/gdiimmpmdoofmahingpgabiikimjgcia
